meta.name: Package name, also the name in the DESCRIPTION file, note that this may be different from the GitHub repo name
meta.type: Category - only packages included for now, may include others later

status.description: Current state of the package, different from installable

levels.good: Everything is good, everything should work fine
levels.hiatus: Taking a break for a reason, e.g., waiting for next version of an API
levels.deprecated: Not maintaining any longer, though may still be installable

meta.category: Category - what the package does/data it deals with
meta.on_cran: Logical - is the package on CRAN
meta.cran_archived: Logical - if the package is on CRAN, is it archived?
meta.url: Code repository URL, usually a GitHub repository
meta.root: Path to root of the R package (if an R package exists). If in root of repo, then zero length string
meta.fork: Logical - is the repo a fork

packages.name: alm
packages.description: R wrapper to the almetrics API platform developed by PLoS  API -other publishers have built on this and work out of the box: CrossRef, Copernicus Publishers, and the Public Knowledge Project (PKP)

packages.name: AntWeb
packages.description: Access data from the world's largest ant database. Maintained and developed by the California Academy of Science

packages.name: aRxiv
packages.description: Access to the aRxiv preprint repository

packages.name: bmc
packages.description: An R interface to Biomed Central (BMC) search API and full text XML

packages.name: citeulike
